page.title: 09SALTBURN SEAFRONT & TOURISM
page.content: In recent years Saltburn's seafront has become more popular appealing more to day trippers than long stay holiday makers.Chalets are available along the seafront .Visitors can walk along the cliffs, promenade and rockpools. Other activities include surfing, swimming, sunbathing, fishing and the sandy beach is good for children. In the summer season cafes and amusements open. The Italian Gardens and woods are a major attraction. The beaches are well used by people of Saltburn as well as visitors from nearby towns and coach trippers from further away. Long stay visitors use the caravan site in Hazel Grove and the few guest houses which are available. Saltburn is part of the Cleveland Way and its Youth Hostel provides accommodation for those interested in exploring its natural environment.
